#Text= Good-by , Freddie , good-by , " called the three Go Ahead boys together , as their comrade obediently followed the call and at once joined his grandfather and the man who had demanded the bond and turned into the street .

column1: #Text=" That fellow was waiting for us , " exclaimed George in surprise .
#Text=" I believe that Mr. Button knew all the time that he was to be here . "
#Text=" Well , what do you make of it ? " inquired Grant .
#Text=" I do n't know what to make of it .

#Text=Then the first thing we know he shows up here at Cape Vincent and orders us to give up a bond which he says we have .

_	_	_	_

#Text= And the worst of it is that we have it , " said George ruefully .

column1: #Text=" HAD it , you mean , " suggested Grant soberly .
#Text=" That 's right , " joined in John .
#Text=" We gave it up and had it recorded in Fred 's name .

#Text=Now I suspect that those two men somehow have put up a job on Fred and that we 'll lose our bond .

_	_	_	_

#Text= ' Our ' bond is good , " scoffed George .

column1: #Text=" Well , whose is it ? " demanded John .
#Text=" That 's what we do n't know , but that does n't mean that everything we see , which may be the property of somebody we do n't know , belongs to us . "
#Text=" Well , if this Mr. Somebody owns that bond why does n't he come and claim it ? " retorted John .
#Text=" It 's my opinion that Mr. Somebody has come , " said Grant dryly .
#Text=" What do you mean ? " inquired George .
#Text=" I do n't know that I mean anything .

#Text=I 'm thinking though that the man who owns that bond , if it is good for anything , is n't going to rest easily until he finds out where it is .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Do you think that boatman owns it ? " asked John .

column1: #Text=" It 's plain that he knows something about it , " answered Grant .
#Text=Meanwhile the two girls in the party were becoming somewhat impatient .
#Text=" My , nobody knows how thirsty I am ! " said Miss Susie , who had been an interested listener and for some strange reason had not joined in the conversation .
#Text=" Plenty of water around here , " suggested John .
#Text=" I do n't mean that , " said the girl quickly .
#Text=" I mean something cold . "
#Text=" And frozen ? " asked John .
#Text=" My , how quick witted you are ! " laughed the girl .
#Text=" That 's exactly what we want . "
#Text=" I suppose we might as well give in first as last , " said George in mock despair .
#Text=" If anybody knows where we can get any ice cream we 'll start . "
#Text=" We 'll start anyway , " spoke up Miss Susie .
#Text=" If we start we shall find it . "

#Text=Evidently success attended the efforts to locate the ice cream parlors for long before the return of the boys and girls to the Black Growler , Fred and his grandfather had come back , the latter becoming more impatient with the failure of the young people to appear .
#Text=Sam Hodge meanwhile had been busily engaged in his inspection of the machinery of the Black Growler .
#Text=When his task was completed he did not make any remarks , but his face apparently beamed with satisfaction .
#Text=" Sam , " said Fred , " what do you think our chances are against that Varmint II ? "
#Text=" ' Gainst the which ? " demanded Sam .
#Text=" That motor-boat that we were racing . "
#Text=" I think it will depend somewhat on how fast we go , " said Sam .
#Text=" What a wise man you are , " laughed Fred .
#Text=" I might have thought of that myself if I had tried hard .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= I think we can if we go faster than she does , " replied Sam .

column1: #Text=" Well , can we make her go faster ? "
#Text=" You can if the speed is in her . "
#Text=" Well , do you think the speed is in her ? "
#Text=" I ca n't say just yet , " said Sam , who was not to be moved from his cautious position .
#Text=" Here come your friends , " he added as the boys and girls were seen approaching the dock .

#Text=Mr. Button grumbled over the delay which had been caused by the failure of the young people to return , but as no one except Fred understood just what he was saying slight attention was paid him .
#Text=Meanwhile at Sam 's command the engine was started , and the Black Growler , free from the dock once more , soon was noisily and speedily making her way down the mighty river .
#Text=" Why did n't you beat that other boat ? " demanded Miss Susie of Fred .
#Text=" That was n't what we were trying to do . "
#Text=" Well , what were you trying to do ? " demanded the girl .
#Text=" Testing our boat and at the same time trying to find out what time they could make in the Varmint II .
